types.name: Query
types.description: Query the site.

fields.name: tenantResources
fields.description: Find tenant resources that service the given location, ordered by their proximity to the location. Note that if the tenant resource directory is disabled on this endpoint, this will resolve to null.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the tenant resource.

fields.name: website
fields.description: The primary website of the tenant resource.

fields.name: phoneNumber
fields.description: A U.S. phone number without parentheses or hyphens, e.g. "5551234567".

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the tenant resource, including the services it provides.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The street address of the resource's office, including borough.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude of the tenant resource's address.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude of the tenant resource's address.

fields.name: milesAway
fields.description: The distance, in miles, that the resource's address is located from the location provided in the query. The distance represents the 'straight line' distance and does not take into account roads or other geographic features.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: SessionInfo
types.description: Information about the current user.

fields.name: onboardingInfo
fields.description: The user's onboarding details, which they filled out during the onboarding process. This is not to be confused with the individual onboarding steps, which capture information someone filled out *during* onboarding, before they became a full-fledged user.

fields.name: latestHpActionPdfUrl
fields.description: The URL of the most recently-generated HP Action PDF for the current user.

fields.name: hpActionUploadStatus
fields.description: The status of the HP Action upload (document assembly) process for a user.

fields.name: prefersLegacyApp
fields.description: Whether we should redirect this user to the legacy tenant app after they log in. If null, the user is either not a legacy user, or legacy app integration is disabled.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The ID of the currently logged-in user, or null if not logged-in.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: The first name of the currently logged-in user, or null if not logged-in.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: The last name of the currently logged-in user, or null if not logged-in.

fields.name: phoneNumber
fields.description: The phone number of the currently logged-in user, or null if not logged-in.

fields.name: csrfToken
fields.description: The cross-site request forgery (CSRF) token.

fields.name: isStaff
fields.description: Whether or not the currently logged-in user is a staff member.

fields.name: isSafeModeEnabled
fields.description: Whether or not the current session has safe/compatibility mode compatibility mode) enabled.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The user's address. Only street name and number are required.

fields.name: borough
fields.description: The New York City borough the user's address is in.

fields.name: addressVerified
fields.description: Whether the user's address was verified by a geocoder. If False, it is because the geocoder service was unavailable, not because the address is invalid.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: isInEviction
fields.description: Has the user received an eviction notice?

fields.name: needsRepairs
fields.description: Does the user need repairs in their apartment?

fields.name: hasNoServices
fields.description: Is the user missing essential services like water?

fields.name: hasPests
fields.description: Does the user have pests like rodents or bed bugs?

fields.name: hasCalled311
fields.description: Has the user called 311 before?

fields.name: leaseType
fields.description: The type of lease the user has on their dwelling.

fields.name: receivesPublicAssistance
fields.description: Does the user receive public assistance, e.g. Section 8?

fields.name: signupIntent
fields.description: The reason the user originally signed up with us.

types.name: OnboardingInfoSignupIntent
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: LOC
enumValues.description: Letter of complaint

enumValues.name: HP
enumValues.description: HP action

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: HPUploadStatus
types.description: The status of the HP Action upload (document assembly) process for a user.

enumValues.name: NOT_STARTED
enumValues.description: The user has not yet initiated document assembly.

enumValues.name: STARTED
enumValues.description: The user has initiated document assembly, and we're waiting for a remote service to upload the result to us.

enumValues.name: ERRORED
enumValues.description: Something went wrong during the document assembly process.

enumValues.name: SUCCEEDED
enumValues.description: The document assembly process was successful.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The landlord's name.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The full mailing address for the landlord.

fields.name: isLookedUp
fields.description: Whether the name and address was looked up automatically, or manually entered by the user.

fields.name: mailChoice
fields.description: How the letter of complaint will be mailed.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime
value as specified by
[iso8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

types.name: LetterRequestMailChoice
types.description: An enumeration.

enumValues.name: WE_WILL_MAIL
enumValues.description: Yes, have JustFix.nyc mail this letter for me.

enumValues.name: USER_WILL_MAIL
enumValues.description: No thanks, I'll mail it myself.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31 - 1) and 2^31 - 1 since represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specifiedby [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Mutations
types.description: Mutate (i.e., change the state of) the site.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A list of validation errors in the form, if any. If the form was valid, this list will be empty.

types.name: StrictFormFieldErrorType
types.description:
This is similar to Graphene-Django's default form field
error type, but with all fields required, to simplify
the type system.

fields.name: field
fields.description: The camel-cased name of the input field, or '__all__' for non-field errors.

fields.name: messages
fields.description: A list of human-readable validation errors.

fields.name: extendedMessages
fields.description: A list of validation errors with extended metadata.

types.name: ExtendedFormFieldError
types.description:
Contains extended information about a form field error, including
not only its human-readable message, but also additional details,
such as its error code.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A human-readable validation error.

fields.name: code
fields.description: A machine-readable representation of the error.

inputFields.name: area
inputFields.description: The area for the issues being set.

inputFields.name: other
inputFields.description: Any other custom issues the user wants to report.

fields.description: A list of validation errors in the form, if any. If the form was valid, this list will be empty.

types.name: LogoutPayload
types.description:
Logs out the user. Clients should pay attention to the
CSRF token, because apparently this changes on logout too.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A list of validation errors in the form, if any. If the form was valid, this list will be empty.

types.name: LoginPayload
types.description:
A mutation to log in the user. Returns whether or not the login was successful
(if it wasn't, it's because the credentials were invalid). It also returns
a new CSRF token, because as the Django docs state, "For security reasons,
CSRF tokens are rotated each time a user logs in":

    https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/ref/csrf/

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A list of validation errors in the form, if any. If the form was valid, this list will be empty.

types.name: PasswordResetPayload
types.description: Used when the user requests their password be reset.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A list of validation errors in the form, if any. If the form was valid, this list will be empty.

types.name: PasswordResetVerificationCodePayload
types.description: Used when the user verifies the verification code sent to them over SMS.

fields.name: errors
fields.description: A list of validation errors in the form, if any. If the form was valid, this list will be empty.

types.name: PasswordResetConfirmPayload
types.description:
Used when the user completes the password reset process
by providing a new password.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
